page.title: 18Brisley Green
page.content: Brisley Green is a large open area of grass S.E.of the church and near the Bell pub.It is sometimes called the Common. The seven acres of grassland are split into two parts by a road. The Green has tufts of grass here and there and there are ponds near the boundary. A bridge crosses over the ponds. From the Green you can see the top of the church,houses and trees. There is a restaurant on one side called The Commons. Animals such as horses,cows,sheep and goats graze on the common. Sometimes sheep run across the road and get killed. On one corner of the Green there is a cricket pitch. It is used by Brisley Cricket Club on Saturdays and Sundays. Lots of people come to watch the games of cricket.
